title: RIP: J.R. CASH
content:
I've seen no sign of (typophile) acknowledgement of the passing of this great man.   
   
So here is mine:   
   
His music has been with me since I was a child, I am very sad to see him go.
author: Hildebrant

comments.content: I fixed my old turntable so I could listen to the "I walk the line" LP, which I got from my mum when I was 8.

I was so hoping that he'd have won at least one of the two MTV MusicAwards he was nominated for. The video was one of the most touching I've seen in a very long time, the song is a killer and it would simply have been nice to see someone like Cash win something... anything... on a channel like MTV. Instead we get Justin Timberlake. Yeah... right. I hope now that Cash is dead, someone at MTV is kicking him- or herself in the bee-hind ;-).
He received a few Grammys. Forget MTV, afterall MTV is to music like KFC is to chicken.

:-)   
I really wuld have liked that though, it would have been so against the grain of what MTV usually stands for. I was utterly surprised to even see Cash nominated and thought it would have been neat if the old man snatched away the moon man from singers that grew out of drawing-board-designed boy bands. I'm not that big a fan of Cash, but it would have been a great moment anyway.

Some words about songs and Cash by Tim Robbins.   
   
 ![JCASH](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020185550im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/16151.jpg)   
From the Score for "Dead Man Walking" (Including "In Your Mind" by J Cash). Columbia, Sony.   
Booklet Design: Christine Wilson
John Ritter died the same day too, don't forget.

In Justin Terblake's defense:   
   
It was nice to see that he said "He didn't deserve the award, and that he was just 'accepting it' for Cash."   
   
That in my mind was very cool.
Yes, I thought so too. Sounded quite honest as well.

"General Discussions   
Anything goes."   
   
If what your saying is true -- maybe this should not be the title of the area in the forum. Maybe it should be   
   
"General Discussions   
Anything TYPE related goes."   
   
To me, and maybe I'm crazy for thinking this, anything goes, means anything goes. To me this means anything from the perspective of a member of the type community.   
   
no?   
   
hildebrant.

No problem.   
   
More a statement than anything.

my baseball team in london has used 'Ring of Fire' as a theme song since the beginning for the Richmond Flames. [www.londonbaseball.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020185550/http:/www.londonbaseball.co.uk/)  
has a story since the day he died on the first link below the main story, 'Cash goes down swinging'. There was a nice piece on NPR yesterday about June Carter Cash.

\>anything goes, means anything goes   
   
Sure, but especially appreciated are comments on typography associated with Johnny Cash (Yay, Ignacio).   
   
Not being a Cash fan, I draw a blank there. (But would have been willing to discuss the cover of "London Calling" at great length.)
London Calling.. Clash ... it was a copy of Elvis LP cover... It was a punk copy of king rock Elvis..Poor Joe Strummer..

\> There was a nice piece on NPR yesterday about June Carter Cash.   
   
Yeah I cought that, it was a re-play from the show they did right after she died. She was quite a spectacular women too. It was inspiring to see how much in love they were after soo many years. Something Johhny never failed to do was praise his wife and keep there relationship as fresh as the day they met.   
   
Hildebrant.

_I've seen no sign of (typophile) acknowledgement of   
the passing of this great man._      
Well, we can't be _too_ inclusive, can we? This still   
_is_ a type related board. I don't think this thread   
really belongs here. And BTW recently Joe Strummer   
died too, and what about Katharine Hepburn, and so   
on and so on... Where does it stop?   
   
_He received a few Grammys. Forget MTV, after all MTV   
is to music like KFC is to chicken._      
Grammys don't mean $h!t neither, pardon my French.   
   
Don't get me wrong: as a musician in a rock band,   
I held the man in great esteem and am saddened by   
his passing, BUT it wouldn't have bothered me if   
this hadn't been mentionned on Typophile.

Okay with me. I just tried to find an answer to the thing   
that puzzled you:   
_\> I've seen no sign of (typophile) acknowledgement of   
the passing of this great man._
